bug.author: imneonizer
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
i am trying to write some piece of text and for new line i am using \n the expected behaviour should be texts in multiple lines but what happens is after first line break the text is automatically gets into a uneditable textbox. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Try out this snipped: st.subheader('Plug into nirvana') st.write("""90% of people love to enjoy music, while they are working!\n are you one of them, we have a curated list of chillout tracks\n that may help you bring out the calmness in you. """) <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
text should be written with line breaks <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
line breaks are visible but the text goes into an uneditable textbox <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.49.0 Python version: 3.7.3 OS version: Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS Browser version: 78.0.3904.70 (Official Build) (64-bit)
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13932346/67832248-0e040c80-fb07-11e9-9c8b-522cbc4e8bec.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment:
there is a workaround to achieve my final goal i.e., using st.markdown with unsafe_allow_html=True but since there is no gurantee of html support in future i don't want to go with this way. st.subheader('Plug into nirvana') st.markdown("""90% of people love to enjoy music, while they are working!
are you one of them, we have a curated list of chillout tracks
that may help you bring out the calmness in you. """, unsafe_allow_html=True) This works fine for me.

I think this is because Markdown handles indented lines as a code block. You can try this to avoid indentation: st.subheader('Plug into nirvana') st.markdown( "90% of people love to enjoy music, while they are working! 
" "are you one of them, we have a curated list of chillout tracks 
" "that may help you bring out the calmness in you." ) Two spaces in the end of the line create a line break in Markdown. Or just use st.write st.subheader('Plug into nirvana') st.write( "90% of people love to enjoy music, while they are working!
" "are you one of them, we have a curated list of chillout tracks
" "that may help you bring out the calmness in you." )

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/vemel>@vemel</denchmark-link> thanks for the help, next time i'll use two spaces for the line break, though writing every line in "--" quotes is not very a efficient way.
